newsitem.title: USA: Ag-Chem Equipment settles patent case.
newsitem.headline: Ag-Chem Equipment settles patent case.

text.p: Ag-Chem Equipment Co Inc said it reached an agreement to settle a patent infringement dispute between its Soil Teq Inc unit and Tyler Industries Inc of Benson, Minn.
Ag-Chem said the court ruled that a patent owned by Soil Teq, which relates to a method and appartus for applying fertilizer and other products, was valid and enforceable.
Under the settlement, Soil Teq granted Tyler a license. Other specific terms of the agreement were confidential and not disclosed.
In a separate statement, Tyler said all claims against it were dismissed. Tyler also dismissed its claim for false advertising against Soil Teq and Ag-Chem.
Tyler said the litigation was initiated by Soil Teq in December 1993 in federal court in Minneapolis.
Ag-Chem makes and markets a line of self-propelled, off-road chassis. Products include row-crop machines and high-flotation vehicles.
Tyler makes fertilizer and farm chemical handling and application equipment.
